properties.areaDesc: Dent, MO; Shannon, MO; Texas, MO
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 12:42PM CST until January 19 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Shannon County in south central Missouri...
Dent County in south central Missouri...
Texas County in south central Missouri...

* Until 1245 AM CST Sunday.

* At 1241 PM CST, gauge reports indicated flooding across the area.
Up to one and a half inches of widespread rain fell yesterday and
last night. While no additional rain is expected, residual
flooding will continue through this evening.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the advisory include...
Ozark National Scenic Riverways...
Echo Bluff State Park...
Current River State Park...       Montauk State Park...
Salem...                          Mountain Grove...
Licking...                        Cabool...
Houston...                        Winona...
Birch Tree...                     Eminence...
Summersville...                   Bunker...
Raymondville...                   Huggins...
Plato...                          Montier...
Jadwin...                         Gladden...

This advisory includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route H, 3 miles east of Winona...
Route H at Rocky Creek 6 miles northeast of Winona...
Route H at Thomas Hollow 8 miles northeast of Winona...
Highway 119 at Pigeon Creek near Montauk State Park...
and Route U at The Jacks Fork 2 miles northwest of Clear Springs.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
